page.title: 10THE GIRLS' MASONIC SCHOOL
page.content: The Masonic School was founded in {1788} by {The Chavalier Ruspini.}It was originally set up for orphans but now it has other pupils as well.{Queen {Mary }opened the school in {1789. }In the first few years the girls made their {own }uniforms and the Headmistress was called 'Matron'. The new school is in { {Rickmansworth.}It costs {Â£1,360 }a term for senior boarders and{Â£740} for a senior day girl per term. For the juniors it costs {Â£816 }for boarders per term and {Â£440}for day girls a term.There is room for {400} juniors and seniors to board.The Masonic School looks over{The River {Chess}and the houses in Copthorne Rd. There are 8 boarding houses. The motto is Circumornatoe ut Similitudo Templi. Translated,"That our daughters may be like the corner stones of the temple."
